Sentencas: The effects of NiO powder morphology and sintering temperature on the microstructure and the electrochemical performance of Nickel-scandia-stabilized zirconia (Ni-ScSZ) cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) were investigated.
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Sentencas: The particle size and agglomeration of the starting powders were found to affect both the microstructure and electrochemical performance of the Ni-ScSZ cermet anodes.
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Sentencas: The lowest polarization resistance, 0.690 Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C, was measured for the Ni-ScSZ anode prepared with fine NiO powder (similar to 0.5 mu m grain size).
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Sentencas: This was attributed to the increase in the number of reaction sites afforded by the small grains and well-dispersed Ni and ScSZ phases.
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Sentencas: The effect of the anode sintering temperature was also found to affect the anode microstructure, adhesion with the electrolyte, and consequently anode polarization resistance.
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Sentencas: The lowest polarization resistance was observed for the anode sintered at 1400 degrees C and this was 3-5 times lower than the corresponding values for anodes sintered at lower temperatures.
Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes

Titulo: Effect of microstructure on the electrochemical performance of Ni-ScSZ anodes
